text:
“Did you know him?” 

“Yes, I did. He shot himself.” 

Raskolnikov felt a weight on his chest. 

“Were you close?” 

“My sister was his governess.” 

“Any suspicion?” 

“I saw him yesterday. He was drinking.” 

Raskolnikov's face paled. 

“It’s stuffy here,” he muttered. 

“I must go,” he said, forcing a smile. 

“Come back anytime,” Ilya Petrovitch replied, extending his hand. 

Raskolnikov stumbled out, giddy. 

He leaned against the wall for support. 

A porter brushed past him.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov learns about a man who committed suicide, leaving behind a note absolving others of blame, which deeply unsettles him.
